snippet: Why the Supreme Court decision on Harris v. Quinn was a bigger loss for labor than people think.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Cynthia Estlund and Prof William E Forbath criticizes Supreme Court decision that unions cannot collect fees from public employees who do not want to join; contends ruling is bigger loss for labor than people think; asserts unions are reeling as court sided with those who seek to further weaken workers' ability to join with co-workers and bargain collectively.

byline.original: By CYNTHIA ESTLUND and WILLIAM E. FORBATH

lead_paragraph: Why the Supreme Court decision on Harris v. Quinn was a bigger loss for labor than people think.

headline.seo: The Supreme Court Ruling on Harris v. Quinn Is a Blow for Unions
